alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Douglas and northwestern Elbert Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 516 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Parker, or 18 miles southeast of Denver, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, locally heavy rain and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Castle Rock, Parker, Ponderosa Park, Castle Pines, The Pinery, and Franktown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
